resources.string:
Lullabye Help
 
 Main Screen 
 
 Start Fade
 This will start a countdown, once the countdown is complete, Lullabye will slowly fade out and stop the soundscape. You can set how long the countdown is from the options screen. The default countdown is one hour.
 
 Media Volume
 This slider sets the volume for all media played on your phone, ringtone volume is unaffected.
 
 Soundscape Volume
 This sets the volume of the Lullabye app only, and provides much more fine control, allowing Lullabye to play at very low volumes without the sound cutting out.
 
 Category
 Lullabye has many soundscapes, to help make them more accessible, they are grouped together with other similar soundscapes. If the category list is too long to fit on the screen there will be a scroll bar on the right of the list allowing you to see all categories. Picking a new category will stop any soundscape currently playing
 
 Soundscape
 This allows you to select the individual soundscape you wish to listen to. As with the category list, the soundcape list will be scrollable if it is too long to fit on screen. Picking a new soundscape will stop any soundscape currently playing
 
 Start Button
 Starts the selected soundscape playing. Since many soundscapes have silences, A play icon will be displayed when a soundscape is active, just in case there is a long pause at the beginning of the soundscape and it is not clear if it is running.
 
 Stop Button
 Stops the currently active soundscape playing.
 
 
 Options Screen
 
 Play In Background
 This sets Lullabye so it will continue to play soundscapes when the Lullabye screen is not visible. You will need to set this option if your phone has and automatic screen lock, or if you wish to use another app while listening to Lullabye.
 
 Lifeform activity
 This sets the frequency of animal sounds in applicable soundscapes. Moving the slider fully to the left will make animal sounds play continuously, moving to it fully right will make twice as infrequently as default. The minimum setting for the slider is locked at 1/10 of a second, things get very odd at faster speeds. Please note changes in this slider will not be heard until you return to the main screen
 
 Set Fade Out
 This allows you to set the countdown duration to your preferred time. Once the time is set the, fade can be activated from the main screen. Pick the desired time from the Hour/Minute dialog shown after pressing the 'Set Fade Out' button. The longest countdown possible is 24 hours 
 
 Hardware controls.
 
 Volume Buttons:Media Volume.
 
 Home Button:Return to Home, leave Lullabye Running.
 
 Back Button:Hard close app.

About Lullabye.
 Lullabye© 2012 Richard Beech. All rights reserved.

 Version 1.7
 
 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, This Work is provided on an AS IS BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied, including, without limitation, any warranties or conditions of TITLE, NON-INFRINGEMENT, MERCHANTABILITY, or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. You are solely responsible for determining the appropriateness of using or redistributing the Work and assume any risks associated with Your exercise of permissions under this License.

Whats New in Version 1.7
 2 new fire soundscapes.
 Removed river soundscape, its was not up to the quality of other soundscapes.
 Cleaned up many sounds to remove background noise.
 Improved timing on Nature soundscape generator, this has considerably improved the audio quality.
 Version 1.6 
 Compatible with Android 1.6+ thousands of new devices supported.
 Version 1.5
 French and Mandarin language support (activated when the appropriate Android system language is set).
 Total rework of load process to improve load times and app stability.
 Total Rework of interface logic to remove English language dependency and improve response to user input.
 Improved remote error reporting.
 Version 1.4
 9 new Loon and lakeside soundscapes 

 1.3.1.
 Fixed timing bug in river soundsape. 
 Version 1.3
 Timer to fade out soundscape after user defined time. See help for more details.
 Improved packaging for much smaller app.

Audio filtering to remove annoying clicks when Android audio system turns on.

Media volume slider now updates with system volume.
 Fixed crash if phone back button is pressed while app is starting
 More, user suggested Soundscapes.
 Now compatible with more devices.
 Better handling for small screens, all windows are now scrollable.
